website_summaries.verdict: Though the 256GB Crucial m4 offers good performance in most situations, it's surpassed by competing drives from OCZ and Intel that push SSD technology a bit further.
cons: Outperformed in most tests by competing SSDs
Slow garbage collection demands TRIM support in OS

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I installed this SSD in my 2011 Macbook Pro, it has given my computer a new life. It look very high quality solid state drive. Start up is extremely fast, apps launch up right away & shuting down is faster than before. I own a 500GB 7200 rpm and love it, until I saw a friend of mine upgrade to a 64GB SSD by Crucial. Overall performance is very good even compared to newer drives. Firmware update is quick. It was very easy to install and after reading the reviews, I trust that this drive will last the life on my mac.
customer_reviews.author: Tai P Hua

customer_reviews.title: Good SSD and dies after six years
customer_reviews.text: Excellent SSD. Finally reported S.M.A.R.T. error after more than six years. It still works with constant S.M.A.R.T. errors but we have to replace it with a new one. Fortunately, SSDs are much cheaper than six years ago. Say goodbye to the good old drive. Btw, it takes no more than 20 minutes to clone the SSD to a new larger one with proper free software. It's a new beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Good Shopper

customer_reviews.title: When I purchased this a good 5 years ago
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this a good 5 years ago, this was one of the best SSD's on the market at its price. Solid performance, good storage capacity. This SSD is still going strong but just does not have enough space and does not have the performance that I need now. Moving this to an older rig, this did suffice to use with working with photoediting, video rendering and editing along with some medium high performance gaming. While it is disappointing that the new line of Crucial SSDs have not lived up to its previous m4 line, I hope that in the future it does change and can once again compete with top brands.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jeong Seop Lee

customer_reviews.title: Running Great Since 2011
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Crucial m4 256GB SSD back in 2011. I installed it as the boot drive in a 2010 Sony Vaio laptop. It is still running STRONG in 2018. Used for years as a gaming and home entertainment laptop. Laptop is currently running Windows 10 and used on a weekly basis. I can still play my blizzard library just fine... Great SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Carnage

customer_reviews.title: Once you go SSD you'll never go back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD when the ppg finally dropped below $1 and im glad I did. Its been 4 years and I still havent regretted this purchase. When I first opened the box I was completely shocked at how small this component was! Once everything was installed you instantly tell the difference. The very first thing I did was shut off my comp and start it back up. For the first time in my life I experienced a ~10s start up and from that point I knew I made the right decision in buying only a SSD. I bought the 250GB and still haven't filled it up.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: BBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLLAAAAAZZZZZZZIIIIIIIINNNNNNGGGG  FAST!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This particular drive is a great value. It's ridiculously fast (415 MB/s) and it uses the more reliable 25nm two layer NAND (which has twice the expected life of the newer TLC triple layer NAND). I have this, a Samsung 830 and the new 840 Pro as well as the new Crucial M500; and there is zero perceptible difference between them. The only difference I ever noticed is, the Crucial is less expensive. They're all MLC (2 layer NAND). Don't let the MTBF (mean time before failure) being the same fool you, manufacturers can fudge those numbers as they're "estimated". MLC NAND is much more reliable than TLC (like what's in the cheaper SSD drives e.g. Samsung 840 Evo)
customer_reviews.author: VortextuaL

customer_reviews.title: great os drive
customer_reviews.text: still going great, my main OS is on this and its been over 5 years now without having to reinstall. ssd's are way better then hdd's. i have around 30 programs start at startup and it only takes 10-15 seconds for all of them to load and computer is usable the whole time. speed could be a bit better but this is a 5 year old product and they have much better products out now, i'd suggest getting one of the newer models.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Dead as a brick after 9 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for 9 months. Then, after simply powering off the PC and turning it back on a half hour later, the drive was dead. BIOS reported that there was no hard drive in the system. There is a known defect in this drive (so I found out after buying it). It is an internal defect that even downloading the most recent available update from Crucial does not fix. What you are supposed to do is explained in this link:  It worked once and the drive revived. Two weeks later, the drive died and stayed dead. DO NOT BUY THIS SSD DRIVE. BUY FROM ANOTHER MANUFACTURER. Unless, of course, you like playing Russian Roulette with your computer drives.
customer_reviews.author: AceFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: The good news is, it lasted considerably longer than the Micron and Sandisk drives I had before. Bad news is, two years is still inferior to even a medium-grade hard drive. Performance was more than adequate during its two year run. But as I was foolish enough to install my OS on it, the crash meant I had to do everything from scratch. Took most of my afternoon, I lost a handful of important personal files and a bunch of saved games. Sad that even in 2013 SSD drives just weren't up to the task of heavy constant use. If I investigate and find Crucial has improved their quality I might purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: shorty

customer_reviews.title: Crucial products fails just after warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: I bought this more than 3 years ago on 5 Jun 2012 .. it worked perfectly fine since then ... until today 8 DEC 2015 ... my computer and windows keep showing me warning messages that this hard drive is "BAD" and advice me to backup my files !!! I heard that SSDs has long term life reputation but this was really disappointment ! I won't deal with Crucial products anymore !
customer_reviews.author: iSimzZz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting to jump on the SSD bandwagon until prices came down and now seemed like a good time to buy. There's no doubt that a standard HDD on a laptop is a real performance bottleneck. I installed this in my mid-2009 MacBook Pro without a hitch and it has been performing flawlessly for the past few weeks. Sleep/wake and low-battery hibernate all work perfectly under 10.6.8. The speed has really given the computer new life and will hopefully extend its useful life for many more months. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a reasonably priced SSD with a good reputation for performance and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Sacha Potter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: If you've been into computer for any appreciable length of time, how could you not love these things?! I can't wait until the cost-per-gigabyte ratio improves since I always like buying 512GB or larger drives. But, fast is fast, and this is fast! And quiet, and, did I mention fast? The only downside was finding a bracket.converter/adapter that allowed me to install it into my 3.5" drive bay in my tower case. I had to order four different ones before I found one that worked. It's probably more a function of the tower case but it delayed the installation for a few weeks. Buy the biggest one you can afford - you won't be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: manta

customer_reviews.title: Best SSD Drives out there!
customer_reviews.text: If you can wait for the right price point, like in the $160-$170 range for this drive, you'll have the best performance and reliability ratio for your money. I've used two of these drives now and both have been simple plug 'n play in my Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems. The speed is impressive, with Windows 7 booting in 12 seconds to a fully loaded desktop, and Windows 8 booting in about 4 seconds to a fully loaded desktop. Be sure you have an adapter kit if you're putting this in your PC. Most PC cases only accommodate the larger HDD drives so you'll need an adapter tray for this 2.5" drive. Doug Buchan Buchan Consulting LLC
customer_reviews.author: Doug Buchan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Over 4 Years of Heavy Use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September 2012 as a second hard drive in my aging laptop. I then upgraded laptops to a larger gaming laptop and this remained my primary drive. Today it died (February 28th, 2017) after years of video and photo editing and gaming. I could not be happier with this product and will be using Crucial SSD in the future.
customer_reviews.author: A. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for increasing GB capacity
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in my Lenovo laptop running Windows 7 over a year ago. It has fast speed and is a boost in storage capacity. Crucial makes quality reliable products. They are always advertising newer, bigger, and faster drives. I suggest checking the Crucial web site for their latest models. I'm writing this review in October 2015. There are some issues with inserting a new drive in an older computer due to built-in Intel security features. Various pop-up options and Microsoft downloads allowed me to get everything working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Hettich

customer_reviews.title: Insanely Fast, but will slow some over time.
customer_reviews.text: 2 of these in raid 0 will blow your mind. HD Tune: Intel Raid 0 Volume Benchmark Transfer Rate Minimum : 702.6 MB/sec Transfer Rate Maximum : 1042.5 MB/sec Transfer Rate Average : 970.1 MB/sec Access Time : 0.1 ms Burst Rate : 2594.9 MB/sec CPU Usage : -1.0% **UPDATE** Drive performance will degrade over time, this should be expected - results below after nearly 6 months of heavy use. HD Tune: Intel Raid 0 Volume Benchmark Transfer Rate Minimum : 568.0 MB/sec Transfer Rate Maximum : 1006.0 MB/sec Transfer Rate Average : 797.4 MB/sec Access Time : 0.2 ms Burst Rate : 2469.5 MB/sec CPU Usage : -1.0%
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Andreae

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD for the sole purpose of replacing the 60GB HD in my first gen "fat" PS3. I got the package in time and it took longer to back up my files than to replace the old hd with the new. The PS3 i own is unmodified for the most part and the fans seems to stay constant and the games load a bit faster. The system itself does load faster and shut down faster. I do play alot of RPGs so this is a big plus for quicker game play with less loading. Longevity remains to be seen but i have only been playing on it for about 1 month since the install.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus A. Aguirre Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, much faster than hard disk, get one
customer_reviews.text: The Crucial m4 256GB SSD installed easily -- just line a hard disk. It makes my older desktop PC run much quicker on many different tasks, particularly those that formerly required a lot of hard disk seeks, and has been rock solid for its first couple weeks. Highly recommended. Note that this model CT256M4SSD2, as of September 2012 is about $200 on Amazon. For some unknown reason, the thinner 7mm thick version CT256M4SSD1 is about $50 less, but out of stock. They may be identical except for thickness (and the latter being out of stock on Amazon for an indicated 2-3 weeks). However CT256M4SSD1 doesn't seem to appear on the Crucial site. Maybe it's an obsolete model?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chan

customer_reviews.title: Died after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these that just died on me last week. The partitions all got corrupted and were unrecoverable. It was behaving really weirdly when I tried to reformat and partition it on my macbook (it kept failing to delete partitions), so I took it out of my macbook and put it on SATA on my PC. I then flashed it to the latest firmware from Crucial and reformatted the drive successfully, but after that, the drive would no longer show up on the bus after reboot. It does not show up when I put it in an external USB enclosure either. Very disappointed in this drive. I'll stick to Samsung from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: This is how to speed up your computer
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of reviews with specs for this drive so I will just state what may not be obvious to some. The hard drive is the slowest component of your computer and is almost always the bottleneck. If you want a faster computer, even a several year old laptop (as long as the hard drive is SATA connected) then get one of these. Boot times will be much much faster. Programs will open immediately, everything will be much snappier. Also, the M4 is known to be one of the most reliable SSD's on the market as well as being one of the fastest. Don't even think about it, just get one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good for it's time...
customer_reviews.text: It served it's purpose, but nowadays there are much larger drives to be using. I have since moved on but did not regret the 64gb purchase for $110 back in 2011.
customer_reviews.author: KTGiang

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance
customer_reviews.text: I have a Crucial, Sandisks, OCZs and Samsung drives. Quite honestly I really don't see huge differences between the brands, it's more support, performance and actual issues (blue screens) that I'd look at, which the OCZ has been the only one that I've seen that with. I purchased this drive about a year ago and it's still going strong. The 4/5 is mostly because of the size, I have a slimline HP laptop that's thin and light. This drive fits very tight in the space. This was my first laptop SSD I purchased, so I wasn't really paying much attention to size when ordering. Overall I'm very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: John9241

customer_reviews.title: SSDs, the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: I put their smaller one in my 12 year old Dell XPS 400 about a month ago. It wouldn't sector properly because I had too much data on board. Not their fault. So I upped the size with this one and what a difference! Now understand that the drive didn't add all that much speed, but will be a more reliable storage device. My cousin (geek) had tried others in his laptop and got failures. Tried this one and not a problem since. That convinced me to go this way. You can also go to their website and get this unit. Depending on the market, maybe at an even better price. They stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D. Igo

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade for a computer
customer_reviews.text: 256GB is a good size for laptop or desktop as long as you keep your media / photos on another drive. It may not be the fastest drive, but it is (relatively) inexpensive and it speeds up boot time and application launch significantly. Mine has been working flawlessly in my desktop for more than a year now, with heavy use. I configured Windows 7 so that my downloads, music, videos, and documents are all stored in another drive (a regular 3.5" disk). On a laptop, you get faster speed, more ruggedness and better battery life. Other than the higher price compared to normal spinning disk, what's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! I guess I could say WOW about 20 times, but I have to say these are great, I put 2 of these in a new gaming build one for my OS and the other for games. I have a 3tb HD that I'll probably put in another computer, because I'm only putting SSDs 256 and larger in this computer, strictly for game downloads. Yes Im rich and I don't have to deal with regular hard drives any longer. Time is money,$$ and if your waiting on your computer, you dont have to wait any longer. If your watching your dollars a Crucial m4 128gb for your OS is perfect, instant bootup and no lost time. Thanks 4 your time.
customer_reviews.author: P. CRAMER

customer_reviews.title: Crucial SSDs: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two 64 GB Crucial SSD's, and this is my third. I haven't had any problems, either over time or out of the box. They're super quick, reliable, and appropriately priced. I've read a lot of reviews and talked to friends about other SSD's, and though showier products and claims of higher speeds might exist, reliability is sacrifice. Before you go buy either a cheaper alternative, or a fancier model, consider that Crucial's drives are reliable and they're not wasting time and money trying to build a showy, flashy product to appeal to gamers and performance PC builders- even though their product works well in those categories.
customer_reviews.author: AGB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Dropped this drive in my 17" MacBook Pro. It went right in with no problems, and made a real difference in performance. Boots and app launches are much faster, drive intensive chores are also noticeably faster. And NO moving parts. I travel with my laptops and my drives take a beating. I'm glad to not worry about spinning platters any more. I also used to have an occasional problem with the computer refusing to wake after sleep, forcing me to perform a hard reboot. That must have been drive related as well, because it hasn't happened since I installed this drive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: ... of these 4 years ago and it's still running fine as the root drive on my main system
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 4 years ago and it's still running fine as the root drive on my main system. In fact it outlived the system it was installed in. A bit small nowdays, and there are more modern drives available now, but it's still a good drive.
customer_reviews.author: H. D.

customer_reviews.title: Seems great, though I've not tried benchmark tests, etc. (no apparent need)
customer_reviews.text: 2012 December. First ran XP on D630, 4GB RAM Dual Core. Was super fast. My first XP crashes happened in 2013 Dec, so I moved the Crucial m4 to a D830 and upgraded to Win7 Professional Ultimate. That experience sucked hardcore, and now I understand the concept of "Winblowz". 2014 Feb After purchasing a Macbook Pro, my first, I decided to try Linux Mint in parallel. Mint 16 with 4GB RAM and Dual Core is great with this Crucial m4! Superior to win7 by far, and IMO slightly over all nicer than the heavy Mac with Maverick. Keeps on ticking!
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: First SSD, so far I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The PC's in my house are all pretty fast, and the bottleneck was the hard drive in both. Not anymore! If you install your OS on this, and maybe a few select commonly used programs, then you will definitely notice a Huge difference in load times. I have not run into any issues so far except for my wife's SSD is almost full from Windows 7 and the Sims 3 (and all of those darn expansions!). I got these on sale with Tax return money and only regret that I didn't wait for larger capacities to go down in price. At least I know it will be an easy decision once we do need to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Digstyle

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy Upgrade for a Mid 2009 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Find an online video illustrating how to clone your existing drive and install it. I used a Vantec NexStar TX 2.5-Inch SATA to USB 2.0 External Hard Drive Enclosure kit to connect the Crucial SSD drive to my MacBook. The cloning can take a few hours. Once the copy was complete, I disconnected the Crucial SSD from the Vantec enclosure and installed the new SSD into the MacBook Pro. While I was at it, I installed Crucial 8 GB Kit (4 GB x 2) DDR3 1066 MT/s (PC3-8500) CL7 SODIMM 204-Pin RAM. At a relaxed and careful pace, the installation will take less than 15 minutes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DC Jakel

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid after 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: Have had this drive almost a year now and it has been rock solid. I've been extremely impressed by the support from Crucial in the way of firmware updates; I believe that there have been 4 updates since I purchased the drive. Like most SSD's, this one is extremely fast and makes my system extremely responsive. Originally had Win 7 on it (boot time including POST was 20 sec) and now have Win 8 (boot time including POST 12 seconds). I've read enough about SSD failures that I do regular system images, but, this drive has not skipped a beat - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Gardener from TX

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these drives spread out across a handful of Ubuntu systems: a laptop, a desktop, and a thin client running XBMC. I saw massive decreases in boot times and application loading times on each system. Running 'hdparm -t' for each system yields the following speeds: Laptop (Dell N5050 - i3-2350M): 421.09 MB/sec XBMC thin client (Foxconn NTA3500 - AMD E-350): 248.64 MB/sec Desktop (Acer - AMD A6-3620): 403.24 MB/sec These are great numbers especially when you consider how cheap these drives are. I get similar results from an Intel 520 series SSD on another system. However, the Intel drive costed twice as much! I won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: David Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable drive
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive for a Home Theater PC (and several other PCs since). It is lightning fast; the difference from a conventional hard drive is unbelievable. More than a year later, and it is still just as fast, and no problems whatsoever. A word of warning if you got an older one: there is a firmware update you MUST do, or the drive will eventually stop working. No data will be lost, and the drive will start working once the firmware is updated, but it is best to do it BEFORE it stops working. Newer drives all ship with the updated firmware, so nothing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Of the highest quality
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year and going strong, hassle free, trouble free. This indeed is the best of them out there. I did significant research before choosing Crucial as my first SSD drive and I'm glad I did. Though costing a premium over the other brands, you do away with all the bugs and failures, just plugin and enjoy the SSD experience. You have heard the raves about the speed of SSD. It's true, once you go SSD you never go back. Everything is so much faster, even if you have a weak CPU or meager amount of RAM. The SSD compensates for them all. And Crucial is indeed the goto company for memory!
customer_reviews.author: Hai H. Phan

customer_reviews.title: Better than I could've imagined
customer_reviews.text: I started by putting one of these in my 2008 MacBook. I knew it was going to make a substantial improvement, but it is better than I could've imagined. Everything is just lightning fast now - there is no waiting for anything. I think I'll get several more years out of my laptop now. Its speed made me intolerant of any machine without one, so I installed one in my work laptop, my wife's laptop, and ordered another to replace a failed HD in one of my in-laws' laptops. All four are going strong so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Does not work continuously
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the problem is however it only work a few hours before it crashed. I understand that Samsung and crucial now supply their own cloning software. I purchased cloning software from amazon (apricon) I did not have any trouble using the software or cloning. I am not super technical but confident enough I could read and do the cloning however the drive doesn't continuously work so I'm not sure where the fault lies. I can reboot the pc and it will work fine again until randomly it crashes and I need to reboot again. I have since put my old hard drive back in which I had not problem with other than I wanted faster performance.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great SSD. No frills, just solid and reliable performance. I've been running a pair of them for quite a while now with no issues. I was slow to jump on the SSD bandwagon, as I didn't think it would make that much of a difference, but I couldn't have been more wrong. The SSD made a difference in every aspect of computer use. Boot up time, gaming or application load times, and just in general use the computer feels 'snappier'. If you haven't made the jump to an SSD yet, don't wait any longer. This is a fine drive at a reasonable price, and so far has proven to be very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best computer upgrade ever
customer_reviews.text: I've bought, built, and upgraded computers for over 20 years. I've never had a performance boost like this one! Even though I'm not getting the maximum bandwidth from my add-in SATA3 board that some are getting from their built-in SATA3 ports, the performance boost is amazing! My computer boots in around 20 seconds to the login and then perhaps 5 seconds after that. Everything installs and loads very quickly. I **highly** recommend this solid state drive. I will never go back. (I do have a separate mechanical drive for my massive photo/home video collection but all of my apps install to this drive with 120GB to spare).
customer_reviews.author: Brent W

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Speed, and Size
customer_reviews.text: As with most SSDs, easy to install and very fast. If you are only going to use your SSD for your OS you can get away with a smaller SSD. But when building a system for somebody like my parents or wife (who use their computers almost exclusively for surfing the web and e-mail) this has all the space they will ever need. Why spend money on a huge 2TB mechanical drive that they will only use 50GB of extra storage on? This gives them a great fast SSD to help their OS boot much faster as well as all the storage space they will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmatik

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make your computer new and save money!
customer_reviews.text: This drive was the best purchase I have made in relation to computers. I contemplated buying a new computer due to my computer being so old and slow. Instead I saw a segment on the news that talked about upgrading your computer with an SSD instead of buying a new computer. Best money I've spent. It runs faster now than it did when I purchased it new in 2007!! In fact, it runs faster than the majority of computers on the market right now. I upgraded my RAM and this SSD and it runs fast now with no delays. $150 for everything instead of buying a computer for $800. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: ekherd

customer_reviews.title: I'm never buying a standard HD for software again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive for my newest gaming PC build (Nov 2012). Wow, very fast. Pros: 1. Excessively fast. I clocked a complete reset of my system (Windows 7, 3.5 quad core processor, 16gb ram.) Took less than 40 seconds to shut down and get back to the desktop. 2. I feel the need to list fast twice it is so sweet. I'm spoiled now. Load time on highly graphics enhance Skyrim is less than a few seconds MAX. I occasionally won't see the load screen at all. 3. Small and easy to install. Cons: 1. Very expensive for capacity 2. Older cases may require an adapter to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: No SMART errors, garbage collection/trim has been running seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: It's the m4. Reliable, and quite objectively speedy (ok not as fast as more recent SSD's). I mean, you can pay a premium for the latest OCZ or Samsung 840/850 pros, but I honestly can't objectively tell the difference in speeds. I mean, if you're a benchmarking nut, then ya, you can see the numbers.. Honestly, this SSD is all you need. I own the 256 and the 512 and had each for about 2-3 years now. No SMART errors, garbage collection/trim has been running seamlessly, and no drop in performance; and I do a lot of R/W and I/O
customer_reviews.author: QDan

customer_reviews.title: Good Speed Bump
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for 512GB Solid State drives to be reasonable in price, and it finally happened. I installed this in a 2011 MacBook Pro. I used it to upgrade a 500GB Hitachi drive. I used an Apricorn SATA hard drive upgrade kit ( with a free download of SuperDuper. It took a couple of hours over USB 2.0, but the copy process was hassle-free. Now with solid state, things are noticeably snappier. Boot up time is faster, but not as fast as I thought. Make sure to download Trim Enabler (for Mac) as others have mentioned. It enables TRIM!
customer_reviews.author: C.N.

customer_reviews.title: Don't go without it
customer_reviews.text: They shouldn't sell serious laptops without these! I resisted the solid state drive on account of price, but it saves me a lot of time. No more goofing off at work while photoshop loads. I bought this with the hard drive caddy and replaced my optical drive. I decided to get a case for the optical drive so that I can use it as an external and I couldn't be happier. I've used the optical drive once to install windows in bootcamp, and don't actually expect I'll need it. Have CD drives gone the way of floppy disk drives? This was a major upgrade to my Early 2011 Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: instaclay

customer_reviews.title: 256 gig Crucial drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive and the Crucial cloning software at the same time to install in a brand new computer. Since the computer was new there was little risk doing the installation, not much data to lose. The software worked perfectly, my existing 500 gig HDD is locked in a safe with the entire operating system intact should I ever need it. My computer boots up in seconds instead of minutes. The solid state drive has eliminated the most "likely to fail" component in my system, the conventional hard drive. I'm glad these solid state drives have become affordable because they provide a huge improvement to any computer.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSurfer

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This is one extremely fast storage device. I'm using this in a gaming PC, which now boots up in under 30 seconds from button press to logon screen. 256GB provides enough capacity for everyday uses. I've installed Windows 7 and basic applications on here. I recommend installing core applications and perhaps some games as well on the SSD. Leave document archival and media storage to the HDD. Music and videos will play back just fine from the HDD. I'm very satisfied with this purchase and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Backup Often
customer_reviews.text: I agree with everybody's glowing reviews. I bought this drive in August of 2012 and, for 363 days, it was the best upgrade I could possibly make to my 15" MacBook Pro, 2008 model. However, the drive is now on its way back to Crucial for repair or replacement. Too early to say what happened. I received the Mac version of the BSOD. It seems this problem is well discussed in the Crucial forums. SSD's don't give you the same warnings a spinning HDD might give you just before failure. Be sure to keep those backups current!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I have only one sentence to write in regard to the current "trend" of SSD's that are taking the tech world by storm: "you must believe the hype." This is an unbelievable upgrade. The performance boost it offers blew me away when I first installed it and it continues to thrive months later. Install your OS's on this baby and never, ever look back. Simply incredible; it honestly made me hate HDD's, as they seem unbearably slow and inefficient after my wonderful experience with this drive. If you care at all about performance in your computer, just buy it. Do it. Believe the hype.
customer_reviews.author: TheChrostopher3

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at a moderate price. Works fine up to now, about 3 month. Got some issue with firmware, computer freezes sometime during web browsing using Chrome, resolved after upgraded to windows 8. Weird. Crucial is not the best ssd company. Their products are generally good but does not have very good firmware or software optimization. You can use it flawless with windows but it won't give you kinda insured feeling. I would recommend this product for people with limited budget. Intel or samsung 830 will be better choice
customer_reviews.author: nokimitsuc

customer_reviews.title: Problem with power, firmware, and compatibility.  Avoid.  Samsung is better.
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with Crucial. It has to be the first bootable device on your sata port, it does not play well with other SATA/IDE devices, firmware is buggy. It does not work in a couple of models of Dell servers. Sometimes the power will go out, it is not a reliable drive. After I switched over to Samsung SSD all of my problems went away. I would not recommend any of the Crucial SSDs, it is a night and day difference compared to Samsung. Avoid Crucial, go with Samsung SSD.
customer_reviews.author: winstoncubed

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic drive replacement for Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: After looking at the number of purchases/reviews of this drive, it was pretty clear that it was a great choice. A mere 30 minutes after receiving it, I had it installed, Mountain Lion reinstalled, and started enjoying lighting fast transfer rates. Sorry I cannot thrill you with stories of getting past system errors, driver incompatibilities, or any other issues. It just worked perfectly the first time. This is my first SSD and cannot believe I waited this long. The m4 hits that sweet spot of fantastic price and fantastic performance. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great memory at great prices.
customer_reviews.text: Crucial never fails to deliver good memory. Drive doesn't bench as fast as some of my other ssd's but in real world situations like running an OS, this thing runs just as well as my other higher priced ssd's. Updating the firmware on Crucial ssd's is a breeze, and doesn't even require a reboot! Wish more manufacturers products worked as smooth as Micron/Crucial. Would always recommend Crucial. Update: Still working as good as new! (10/2016)
customer_reviews.author: The Lovable Ol' James

customer_reviews.title: You will become spoiled.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: FAST! Con: Cost, although the recent price drop was nice. Other thoughts: Make sure you flash the latest firmware (which at this time is 0309), and that you set your BIOS to use AHCI. After getting my older system up and running, playing with it for some time, going back to my other 'puters with conventional hard drives - it took forever to load programs - I'm quickly spoiled and will be replacing drives in the other 'puters.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Made my 2007 iMac speedy as my new MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: Once I got a MacBook Air with SSD, using my old 24" iMac from 2007 became a trial. Click... wait... beachball... etc. (I exaggerate, but not by a lot). I decided to take the plunge and install this SSD and I have been extremely satisfied. The five year old iMac is now almost perfectly responsive for day to day task (web browsing, email, etc.), and I can't remember the last time I saw a beach ball. Very highly recommended, especially for the cost; I'm sure it bought me several more years on the old iMac.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Great drive!
customer_reviews.text: I've just installed my Crucial M4-256GB and the difference in speed and battery life is amazing. It is incredibly faster than the old Hitiachi that it is replacing in my Lenovo X201t. Should have made the switch sooner. The Apricorn transfer kit (also at Amazon) was invaluable. Both products are highly recommended. EDIT: At 45 days the first 256 M4 drive failed. It would no longer read or write, and troubleshooting efforts with tech support failed. They overnighted me a new drive and the replacement is working fine so far. One star removed for the drive failure.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: SSD Test
customer_reviews.text: Got this SSD to test as a secondary drive. Seems speedy enough, but not too sure how to test it's full capabilities accurately in a Windows 7 environment. The only reason I didn't rate it top notch is because it didn't come with any documentation and the container inside the box it was delivered in was damaged. Regardless it is functional. I'm a bit leery of SSD's running the operating system as a boot drive because of all the negative publicity I've read. Regular mechanical hard drives can crash just as easily as an SSD, but I suppose the compromise is how fast they can transfer data vs. ultimately crashing from their limited read/write usage. We will see.....
customer_reviews.author: gymsim

customer_reviews.title: Can I say "new computer"...
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews about SDD's and was hoping my 2011 Mac Book Pro would experience even half of what I read. Now, instead of about 3 minutes to boot, it literally takes 10 seconds. All programs open immediately or within a couple seconds for large programs like Illustrator. All I can say is WOW. You'll need Phillips and Torques micro screw drivers, but after watching a online video, it took less than 20 minutes to change out. My only complaint is with some of the software protection stuff. I had to reenter several serial numbers after restoring from my hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in my mid 2007 MacBook
customer_reviews.text: When the second hard drive in my MacBook crashed, I decided to go with a solid state drive and I am very glad I did. This solid state drive along with upgrading from 2GB to 4GB of ram has increased my computer's power and speed greatly. Applications open much faster, boot times are very fast, and I am able to use more applications/run more processes at once than I was before. For general use, my computer is now at least as fast as my wife's mid 2011 MacBook Pro 13". I only wish I had gotten a larger drive.
customer_reviews.author: nruntsch

customer_reviews.title: The most reliable SSD hard drive up to date.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe its not the fastest, but it's 4 sure most reliable SSD on the market today,according to numerous online reviews. Marvel III chip prove itself more stable=compare to all others. This SSD, more like regular SATA HDD but, 5x faster!!! My friends tried in the past 2012; Samsung , Crsair, Force III...I can't recall all ))). So they know better :P PS The only thing with this one = if it's made in Honk Kong, Singapore...it's much better, compare to made in China (cuz of the bad quality control). It's like playing lotto.LOL
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Improved performance in Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: I installed one of these drives on a very frequently used workstation handling a wide variety of activities in WIndows 7 from CAD to more garden variety productivity programs. This drive created a noticeable difference in performance that the end-user noticed immediately. I recommend this drive as a replacement to any aging drive whose mechanics are failing. If you're looking for something to image over to, this is the ticket. Be mindful to leave a small gap at the beginning of the drive when you format it or performance will suffer.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Kanoa Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Speeds up my game
customer_reviews.text: Ever get sick of loading screens? Do you hate waiting for the computer to start up, and then waiting again for the game to start up? Are you tired of your Windows Experience Index being held back by your hard drive speed? Have no fear, SSD is here. Install was easy, but to get the most out of it I would recommend doing some research first into setting up your User Directory to be located on an HDD. After installing Windows, Office, Diablo III, Starcraft II, Entropia Universe, and Neverwinter I have about 30Gb left.
customer_reviews.author: David Post

customer_reviews.title: New Life for Macbook Pros
customer_reviews.text: I have a circa late 2009 Macbook Pro, dual core duo, 4gb memory with a 120gb HDD. Slapped on this SSD with 260gb. My first time to open a Macbook. Followed the instructions from all the helpful videos in Youtube. Now, the Macbook just flies! Comparable to a Macbook Air. Boot up time, with the old HDD was 55 seconds. Boot up with the SSD is 19 secs. Shut down is 19 seconds in the old, 2 seconds in the new. Heavy apps like Photoshop, Soundbooth, Final Cut now just opens much, much faster now. A great investment to revive an old friend.
customer_reviews.author: Hardright

customer_reviews.title: Brought my 2008 MacBook Pro back to life!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this into my late 2008 MBP with 8GB ram, in an attempt to make it usable again. After years of wear and tear, it was starting to get sluggish, especially compared to my 2010 work Mac Book Pro. After installing this drive and freshly formatting it with Mountain Lion, I can say that my old 2008 machine feels faster and much more responsive than my work machine! This is one of the best upgrades you can do to any machine! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wigginton

customer_reviews.title: OS Install And Load Times Are Now Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as purely a boot device for a NTPC with only passive cooling. Pros: -Outstanding install and boot times for OS -Works straight out of the box (unlike other SSD brands I've used) -Incredibly light weight and a breeze to install -The most quiet HD I've ever used -No need for additional cooling options -Backwards compatible with 3Gb/s SATA Cons: -Not really. Just have to keep in mind to pair it with a good processor and motherboard. Minimum 1.5Ghz dual core is when I started to see real improvements in response times from this HD.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dip

customer_reviews.title: My very first SSD
customer_reviews.text: If you want your computer to boot faster this is the SSD for you! I upgraded for a 7200 RPM mecanical disc to this one, the diference is brutal! I use my PC for gaming mostly, but this SSD is not used to run games so there is no difference there. very easy to install and configure! You will probably need Mushkin Enhanced MKNSSDBRKT2535 3.5-Inch to 2.5-Inch Drive Adapter in case your computer case has no special space for SSDs. Buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: Latis

customer_reviews.title: Crucial m4 256GB 2.5-Inch Solid State Drive SATA 6Gb/s CT256M4SSD2
customer_reviews.text: Have a 17" MacBook Pro going on 4 years. I usually change my computer after the extended warranty is over but with things how they are decided instead to upgrade with this drive. I took out the DVD drive and put the Solid State there and upgraded my internal to 1TB. I then put the OS and applications in the SSD and it's like I have a new computer! Apps launch incredibly fast and overall although I have no way of scientifically testing the new arragement I would say I'm 30% faster overall. Very much worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Vicioso

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance on older macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girl friends macbook pro. The drive has been a great performance upgrade from her stock 5400 rpm hard drive. I have achieved 250 + write and 260+ read on her limited SATA II connection. This drive has made a huge change in the day to day use of her machine, she has been very thrilled with the instant launch of applications. This drive help prevent me from having to buy her a macbook air to get that instant performance she wanted. I know a 13' macbook pro older model is no air but that was the only killer feature she wanted and this provided that. This drive total revitalized her machine.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worthy improvement
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the original HDD that went belly up. Glad it did because this SSD greatly improved the performance of the laptop from boot, sleep to wake, and other I/O tasks where the old HDD would just churn and churn. No problems encountered so far. Just made the laptop much faster and more pleasant to use. Tons of other reviews with specifics and numbers but to me the point was it made a noticeable difference in the overall user experience. You will especially love the improvement in sleep to wake times. Can't wait until these basically become more standard and lower in price.
customer_reviews.author: Jan-micahel

customer_reviews.title: Its like a Hard Drive but on Steroids..
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SSD so coming into it I wasn't expecting much of a difference but was totally shocked at how fast it boots windows, loads up applications, installs software,etc.. I installed the 64gb SSD onto my HP Pavilion 2000 Intel Core i3 laptop with about 40gb left over to install programs and for personal storage. I didn't really need the 320gb use of space the laptop came with anyway. I have a dedicated htpc/media server for enjoying my media content for that purpose. So what storage I need is on the laptop or stored in the cloud. I highly recommend this for an upgrade so much that I plan on purchasing another one for my htpc.
customer_reviews.author: Kory Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great value, awesome speed
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty high-end laptop with lots of memory and an i7. But I didn't opt for an SSD when I bought it, because I knew it would be cheaper to add one after market. After adding the Crucial m4, the difference is night and day. My Thinkpad starts up in seconds and even loading something like Eclipse or OpenOffice happens almost immediately. While I can't say what might be better about Crucial as opposed to similarly specced solid state drives, I can say I have had no problem with it and I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken in Denver

customer_reviews.title: hard disks are out SSD is it!
customer_reviews.text: I had two Western Digital veloci-Raptors 300GB each in RAID-0 array. I play rFactor F1 race sim and would always get framerate drop from 120 into the 40s when all 21 AI players were in front of me. With this SSd I now get a consistent framerate in the same scenario. No framerate drop! Windows 7 loads in a fraction of what it used to. Load times have greatly decreased for all programs. GIMP's load time has greatly reduced. GIMP is a FREE image editing program with a large community fan base support. A search of GIMP on youtube will reveal its use. Gimp is Photoshop without the price. GIMP.org
customer_reviews.author: Leticia

customer_reviews.title: A must, for any build!
customer_reviews.text: I was building a home theater pc and decided to get a smaller SSD for the OS. What a great decision that was! I had a Windows 7 install USB key, and was installing the OS from scratch to the SSD. The process of installing Windows took less than 10 minutes. In all my years of installing and reinstalling operating systems, this has been the fastest and smoothest process. I highly recommend you get an SSD for whatever system that you're building, or even if you want to improve your existing system.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic on my video editing rig!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this drive when the price came down below a dollar / gig. I've owned multiple Crucial m4 128 MB versions and I needed more space for with my video editing rig so I got this 256 MB version. My computer is a dell xps 8300 with i7 at 3.4 GHz. Strangely, this drive benchmarks slightly slower than the 128 MB version (at least on my computer). But in real world performance, I can't see any difference. The reason I changed from a 128 to 256 GB drive is so that Adobe Premiere CS5 could have more room for the scratch disk. Great drive, the cruical m4 drives have been rock solid for me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: I have acquired two of these drives. I have one in my MacBook Pro 13" and another in a Lenovo ThinkPad X201. For the windows PC the difference is unbelievable. I suddenly have a system that boots in 12 seconds and the usual paging with a large outlook file is totally gone. The system is very responsive and it is just like getting a new computer. On the MacBook the experience is similar, very fast boot time, excellent performance. If you laptop is a bit sluggish consider updating to an SSD drive. I have tried several different brands, but this by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Henrik I. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Fast. period
customer_reviews.text: This drive was replacing a stock 750GB HDD, since I had a solid state drive it became cumbersome using a HDD since it doesn't have near the speed. First of all I purchased a copy of HDCopy Basic for a about $20 from , and connected my new drive via a SATA USB adapter then used HDCopy while in Windows to image my HDD to my SSD. No issue there perfectly copied with HDCopy. I then put the drive in my Laptop, powered on an booted Windows 7 in about 5-6 seconds, WOW! I essentially have a new laptop this thing is fast,
customer_reviews.author: Dynamiclynk

customer_reviews.title: SSD without trouble
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, it did speed things up regarding start up, but not as much as I expected, but not sure if I have everything set correctly, I am a casual user. Where I did notice super speed was using DVD FAB, a ripping software. Before I would get a rate of 160-180 FPS, now I am getting 384 FPS, fantastic. My i7 processor used to never go above 20% on the CPU meter, now it screams, I even hear the CPU fan meaning it is finally being given enough info to actually do some quick work. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Love these small capasity ssd drives!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these drives to work in our point of sale machines. At the time they were the cheapest ssd drive we could find. We only needed the operating system and point of sale software to be loaded since the machines will be dedicated to a single software task and nothing else. So far the drives are working everyday since we bough them and they are used atleast 15 hours each day. So far no problems and they are really fast to boot up the operating system.
customer_reviews.author: miketheman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible in my 2011 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this SSD in my 17" 2011 MacBook Pro for several months and never had 1 issue with it. It is an incredibly fast drive as you can see form the plethora of reviews on the internet about it. And for me it has absolutely worked flawless for me, I couldn't be happier and it may be one of the best purchases I have ever made. I would definitely recommend the Crucial M4 drives to anyone looking for a hassle free , high end performance SSD.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive,fast performance
customer_reviews.text: While this is not the fastest SSD around, it is definitely a major step up over mechanical hard drives. I upgraded a computer with this drive, using this drive for the OS and applications, while keeping a mechanical drive for media storage, With this drive, Windows 8 boots up in less than 15 seconds from being completely off. Applications open instantly. I tested my most intensive application, Adobe Photoshop, which loaded up in less than 7 seconds and Illustrator which loaded up in 8 seconds. I am very pleased by the performance and price of this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A.

customer_reviews.title: The fast lane
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new computer with the Intel i7 chip and had the retailer install this Crucial SSD in the computer and transfer the operating system. So far the fastest and best computer I've owned. My old computer, an HP Pavilion Elite with an AMD 2.4Mhz chip (about 3 years old,) with the same setup, took between 5 and 10 minutes to fully boot-up. The new computer takes about 2 minutes. Programs that used to take several minutes to fully execute, now usually take, literally, just a few seconds. I highly recommend this solid state drive.
customer_reviews.author: teslercpa

customer_reviews.title: amazingly fast, works great out of the box - every pc deserves one
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about the m4, it's one of the highest ranked and reviewed ssd's on the market other than intel branded ones - but it's faster than intel's comparably priced. It's not the cheapest on the market but you get what you pay for here. I switched from another brand of drives which while customer service was great when it died... it still died. You won't find a faster more reliable alternative. If you ask me, no modern pc belongs without one - the difference in speed is astounding.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis M. Kuszek

customer_reviews.title: Now residing in my R835
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, just slid snugly right in and closed the compartment, and was up and running. Awesome boot time...of course when you're used to a 3+minute boot (time until all programs are fully loaded up on a 6 year old laptop), this barely over 20 SECOND boot time rocks my electronics world. I can't wait till the prices go down but until then this will definitely hold you over unless you are a file pack rat...in which case get an external drive. Don't know if I can ever go back to the old HDDs again...
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Difference in my Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: When I had to replace a failing hard drive, I decided to upgrade to an SSD. It is my first experience using solid state in a personal computer - and it is an absolutely unbelievable difference. The start up speed is much quicker and every application I seem to open feels like it is just "immediately" ready to run. I did not study a lot of specs before making this decision - just looked at the top few in the 512GB range and compared pricing. This is the best money I've spent for an upgrade. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: EVA M FAILE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced the 500GB (7200RPM) primary drive in my Asus G73 Laptop with this SSD and it blazes! The old Windows Experience Index was 5.4 prior to the replacement, held back only by the hard drive (the other ratings are 7.0 or higher). After the re-assessment, the new WEI is 7.0, which is the graphics card score, but the SSD score is a whopping 7.8 (the maximum is 7.9). Right from the get go, the laptop booted in mere seconds and everything snaps open instantly, even Photoshop. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this into an early 2008 Mac Pro (desktop) with OSX 10.7.2. The performance is on par with what I expected using my SATA II connection. No stalls, no beach-balls. Boot time is about 15 seconds. I do, however, get the black-screen on cold-boot - this is not a big problem for me since I rely heavily on the sleep function. A reboot fixes the black-screen issue. I do want (and expect) Crucial to fix this, though. I enabled TRIM support in OSX and the performance seems consistent, so far, after 3 days of heavy use. Overall I'm quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Failed within 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 256GB Crucial M4 SSD about a month ago and it's been working great so I decided to get a 512 also for an external drive. It worked great for about a day and a half and then just died - coincidentally after I hooked it up to my Retina MBPro where I saw some insane copy speeds (about 450MB/sec). It died immediately after that. Probably just a coincidence. Anyway, I'm returning it for a refund. Gonna try a different brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I got this when ssd's where still a pretty new for just the average Joe to buy one
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got lucky but I have had this ssd for 3 years now and it has not given out on me yet. I have friends that have gone through at least 2 or 3 ssd's. I got this when ssd's where still a pretty new for just the average Joe to buy one. Then, there where some that you could get maybe a year out of if you where lucky before they crapped out on yea. So what I'm trying to say is, there probably are a lot better ssd's out there now, but this one has lasted me a long time and is still chugging.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Very fast
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is very fast and even my browser's seem to load much more quickly. Time from cold boot is less than a minute and from hibernate, just a matter of seconds. Update: This made my laptop so much faster I ordered another for my desktop. I have a quad processor, 8 gigs of ram and Win 7 Utlimate 64 bit running and with the addition of this SSD, it is a blaze. No question my browsing experience is significantly faster as well. In fact, other than the faster boot up, that may be where I'm noticing the greatest increase in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Doplar

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: After owning this for a little over 4 months, the return or replacement option is expired, and now it's just garbage. I remember clicking on something, maybe a send button, and then the screen froze up. Rebooted and no more SSD. Tried it on other PCs and same result. This is my 3rd purchase and last. You think they would be incredibly fast and reliable for the money they cost but you would be wrong like I am. A little disappointed that Amazon doesn't have any leverage with these people to at least get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: justGary

customer_reviews.title: Great speed, very reliable
customer_reviews.text: This was the first SSD that I ever bought and now I use it as test drive for random OS's. The speed is fantastic and it is very durable (I've had it for a couple years now). The reason I don't use it as my main drive now is because of it's size. After you install Windows (or most other OS's) you won't have a lot of space for programs left. I kept running out of space so I upgraded to a 1tb drive. I still recommend this drive to anyone who can get it for a good price and isn't looking to use it as a main drive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Claire

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: used with. blazing fast, windows loads fast, photoshop opens almost instantly, I can now edit images at lightning speed! Easy copy of old HD with Easus and a system repair disc (google it)First had to take off all pics, docs, data, etc due to this drive's small size... and even then I only have about 20gigs left for use...Need to find where the rest of my GB are! Also allows laptop to run cooler and quieter - something this particular laptop is hardly known for!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A smoken boot drive for Windows 7 64 bit system
customer_reviews.text: I built my new PC with this crucial SSD as the boot drive. I was attracted to crucial because you can update the firmware without affecting the data on the drive - something you couldn't do with the OCZ drives last time I looked. I have not had the need to update the firmware, however, as the drive worked fine right out of the box. I am duly impressed with the speed of this drive attached to an Asus P8z68-v pro MoBo. I would have never believed a Windows machine could make it from power on to desktop in less than 30 seconds. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: knitting ninja

customer_reviews.title: Works great, perfect upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: My Sony VAIO CCW26FX laptop was already pretty fast. However, after I upgraded another machine to an SSD, it was obvious that there was room for improvement. I chose the Crucial drive because I wanted something reliable. Honestly, it really woke up the machine as I was expecting. Trying to shrink down from a 500GB drive to a 128GB drive was a little tough at first, but well worth the gain. The machine boots from cold into windows 7 in right around 20 seconds. Most things launch instantly. This machine that I have it in has 8GB RAM and a i520 CPU. If you're on the fence, get it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade for Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old HDD (500 GB) with this drive. While I couldn't quite afford a larger model, this size has been perfect so far. Installing a SSD has made a huge difference in the quality of life with my laptop which was about 2 years old when I installed this about 6 months ago. It boots quicker, it has snappier responses, searching for documents and such is much quicker, the heat generation of the laptop is much less, and the battery lasts longer. Installation was pretty straightforward. I have had no problems with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Q

customer_reviews.title: Go Nike, Just do it...
customer_reviews.text: Does what is expected. It is backwards compatible if wondering. Even at 3Gb/s it is substantially faster than any older drives you may be using and at 6Gb/s you will wonder why you did your last CPU upgrade instead of getting a SSD. Best real world improvement to a computer I have seen in a decade, meaning actual speed improvement you notice when booting up Windows for example. Note my statements probably apply to any SSD in this price range, not so much a "Crucial" one, but so far so good, with the Crucial 256Gb model I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: ShortandSweet

customer_reviews.title: Blazingly Fast
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 64GB model installed for a couple of months as a boot/program drive in my new system with an AMD FX-4100, ASRock Ex4 and 8GB of Kingston HyperX with Win 7. This is the fastest booting system I have ever built or used. Time from pressing the power button to the fully running is less than 15 seconds and that includes a 3 second delay for the BIOS page. Lightroom 4, PSE 10 and all my other programs now start in just a couple of seconds. I only wish I had gotten the 128GB or 256GB version, but the price was quite a bit higher at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Superfast!
customer_reviews.text: Acer Aspire 1830T Intel I7 core 8GB RAM Microsoft Win 7 I've owned my computer for three years. The size, weight, time on battery are the benefits of the this computer. With the I7 core, the computer was competent enough. This SSD storage solution, hands-down, trumps all these benefits. Granted I cleaned the OS and optimized the system. (FOLLOWED SEAN'S METHOD FOR SSD SETUP GOOGLE KEYWORD 'Sean's ssd optimization guide') Highly recommended upgrade to extend life of computer.
customer_reviews.author: franko

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was leery on getting this drive, this is my first SSD. I wanted the 256Gb to be my minnimum but this one had a good price on it. Installation went smoother than I could have ever hoped for. When it came in I imaged my reqular drive. Then placed the boot image and the system image on this drive. At first it wouldn't boot, but I had forgotten to tell the bios it was my boot drive. Then it still wouldn't boot so I put in the orginal Windows DVD and fixed the boot partition, then it worked and has been working great eversince. I would recommend this drive to all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Baird

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased; made windows noticably faster
customer_reviews.text: Drive is small, quiet, and very fast. My Windows performance disk index went from 5.9 (which was the bottleneck) to 7.7 (on a scale of 8). I had a difficult time transferring the operating system initially- my Windows 7 was intended for upgrade only, not a fresh install, and installing WIndows XP and then re-upgrading would have been a real pain (and I'm not sure XP would have liked the drive). Fortunately, I discovered "Paragon Migrate OS to SSD 2.0" - [...] , which was well worth the $20 it cost for the trouble it saved. It copied the OS over with just a few clicks, and it's worked perfectly since then.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stillson

product_meta.title: [OLD MODEL] Crucial m4 256GB 2.5-Inch (9.5mm) SATA 6Gb/s Solid State Drive CT256M4SSD2
product_meta.description:
Capacity:256GBFROM THE MANUFACTURER



THE CRUCIAL M4 SSD




Award-winning quality. Award-winning performance.The award-winning Crucial m4 SSD delivers powerful performance gains for SATA 6Gb/s systems. Designed to empower your system, the Crucial m4 SSD offers faster application load times, faster boot times, and increased durability compared to a traditional hard drive. The results speak for themselves: blazing-fast sequential read speeds of up to 500 MB/s for any file type. 

Cutting-edge technology. Quality component testing. Built with advanced controller technology, Micron proprietary firmware and high-speed synchronous MLC NAND, the Crucial m4 SSD is engineered to deliver consistent, blazing-fast SSD performance. From the extensive research and development that led to its ultimate design, to the hours of testing and validation spent on each NAND component, to rigorous compatibility testing in the Crucial Performance Labs to ensure component functionality, the Crucial m4 SSD is built to last.

Consistently fast speeds. No exceptions and no fine print. Theres a reason the Crucial m4 SSD has garnered numerous international awards since its launchit does what its supposed to do. No matter what kind of files youre working with on a Crucial SSD, youll experience high speeds with no drop in performance.

Unlike other SSDs on the market, Crucial SSDs treat all files the same, regardless of whether theyre compressed or uncompressed. This is important because the files most people use everyday videos, mp3s, advanced graphics files and zip files - are compressed files and thus unable to be compressed any further. While many SSDs on the market achieve faster speeds by using file compression, many of the most common file types cant be compressed, resulting in SSDs that often deliver drastically slower speeds than originally advertised. With the advanced technology of a Crucial SSD, however, youll never have this problem! 

Crucialquality you can depend on. Crucial is a trusted name when it comes to SSDs, and thats no coincidence. As a brand of Micron, one of the worlds leading manufacturers of SSDs, we work with our engineers to design, refine, and support our drives. With over 15 years of experience in the memory industry, NAND component testing, and the ongoing development of advanced technology, we continue to innovate without sacrificing what has made us great: high-quality upgrades and outstanding customer service.

Crucial SSDs. Performance you can trust.
